cleaned_text: South Florida Regular check-ups and screenings are essential for people with diabetes to manage their condition and prevent complications. If you have diabetes, it's important to schedule regular appointments with your healthcare provider and ensure you're up-to-date on all necessary tests and screenings. Here's a checklist of tests that people with diabetes should have: A1C test (measures average blood sugar levels over the past 2-3 months) Blood pressure check Cholesterol panel (measures levels of HDL, LDL, and triglycerides) Kidney function test (measures levels of creatinine and albumin in the blood) Eye exam (checks for signs of diabetic retinopathy) By staying on top of these tests and screenings, you can catch any issues early and work with your healthcare team to manage your diabetes effectively.
